If she [May] does her work systematically and considers in the morning and jots down upon paper just what she intends to do in the orderly accomplishment of her work, she will not lose time but can take up one thing after another. The dishes are not to be left, to do any
177
other part of the work. Attend to the kitchen work first. Then the beds have had a chance to air and may be made up. . . .
